problem_text: Following Yu. I. Merzlyakov we define the width of a verbal subgroup V(G) of a group G with respect to the set of words V as the smallest m ∈ N ∪ {∞} such that every element of V(G) can be written as a product of ⩽ m values of words from V ∪ V−1. It is known that the width of any verbal subgroup of a finitely generated group of polynomial growth is finite. Is this statement true for finitely generated groups of intermediate growth? V. G. Bardakov
